newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Reshuffled Russia still in DeBeers gem talks -govt.
newsitem.headline: Reshuffled Russia still in DeBeers gem talks -govt.

text.p: The Russian government, fresh from a major reshuffle and expecting more changes, continues to negotiate with diamond giant De Beers on a long-stalled gem export deal, a government spokesman said on Tuesday.
"These negotiations have not been cut off," Igor Shabdurasulov told a news conference.
"As you remember, there was a period of public difficulties in relations, when both sides made rather bitter delarations," he said.
"But nonetheless some common ground has been found and the work continues. I think the work will be completed in a fairly short time."
He said the recent cabinet reshuffle had caused some difficulties in the talks but that he did not expect any principal changes in Moscow's position as a result.

De Beers said earlier this month that it hoped to complete a new deal in March and that it expected a resolution from Prime Minister Viktor Chernomyrdin and a decree from President Boris Yeltsin to finalise a deal.
The South African gem group stopped purchases of diamonds from Russia at the end of last year after Moscow failed to approve a new trade deal.
